meanings.definition: The quality of being acceptable or agreeable to the taste
meanings.sent1: The chef's focus on the palatabilities of the dish ensured it was delicious.
meanings.sent2: The palatabilities of the new recipe made it a hit with the customers.
meanings.sent3: The debate over the palatabilities of the spicy sauce was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her writing had the palatabilities of a gourmet meal, satisfying every reader's appetite.
meanings.sent5: The palatabilities of the fresh fruit salad were so enticing that everyone wanted seconds.

meanings.definition: The ability of something to be pleasing or acceptable to the senses or mind
meanings.sent1: The artist's painting had a unique palatabilities that captivated viewers.
meanings.sent2: The palatabilities of the music touched the hearts of all who listened.
meanings.sent3: The palatabilities of the joke left everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: His speech had the palatabilities of a soothing melody, calming the anxious crowd.
meanings.sent5: The palatabilities of the story were so engaging that it stayed with the audience long after it ended.
